185992943.review: Game's an absolute mess. Frame rate constantly dips even on the most powerful of hardware, the controls are super stiff and unresponsive, and the level design is truly atrocious. The serious lack of time playing as sonic in a game with his name in the title is truly mystifying and the return of classic sonic brings nothing to the table but some of the most frustrating controls I've experienced in a game. Skip this game, the avatar mechanic is cool but not a reason to buy this game. Play Sonic X Shadow Generations instead, you'll have a far better experience.

185967804.review:
Não vou fazer review do sonic forces buxa, mas sim do mod incrivel que a comunidade de fans trouxe para esse jogo.
Sonic Forces Overclocked é uma experiência de jogo que realmente eleva a qualidade do título original.

Diversão Aumentada
Jogabilidade Dinâmica: O mod introduz uma jogabilidade muito mais fluida e rápida, permitindo que os jogadores sintam a verdadeira essência do que significa ser o Sonic. Os níveis foram aprimorados para oferecer desafios que testam as habilidades dos jogadores de maneira balanceada.

Controles Aprimorados: Os ajustes nos controles tornam a experiência ainda mais responsiva, permitindo que os jogadores executem manobras complexas com facilidade. Isso resulta em uma sensação de satisfação ao completar cada fase.

Gráficos e Estilo
Visual Melhorado: Os gráficos foram otimizados, apresentando cores vibrantes e detalhes que enriquecem o ambiente do jogo. Cada nível é uma obra de arte, com um design que capta a essência do universo de Sonic.

Animações Suaves: As animações dos personagens e das interações no ambiente são mais suaves e naturais, contribuindo para uma imersão maior no jogo.

Rejogabilidade: O mod aumenta a rejogabilidade do jogo, com múltiplos caminhos e segredos a serem descobertos, o que incentiva os jogadores a revisitar níveis anteriores para completar todos os desafios.

Conclusão
Em resumo, Sonic Forces Overclocked é uma obra-prima de modificação que não apenas corrige as falhas do jogo original, mas também adiciona uma nova camada de diversão e desafio. Para qualquer fã de Sonic, é quase imperativo jogar esta versão. O mod supera o Sonic Forces original em todos os aspectos, tornando a aquisição do jogo justificada apenas se o intuito for jogar esta versão aprimorada.

Se você busca uma experiência de jogo que combina nostalgia e inovação, Sonic Forces Overclocked é a escolha ideal. Prepare-se para correr mais rápido, pular mais alto e se divertir como nunca!

185781072.review:
总体来说缺点大于优点，首先优点就是力量首次使用了新引擎，操作手感以及动作反馈比上代引擎要好，具体效果可以从索尼克世代和夏特世代游玩体现出来，虽然缺点很多但最基本的游玩体验我还是比较满意的所以给了好评；其次人声音乐量很足也很好听，纯音除了夏特世代听了很多的日落高地没几个给我留下深刻印象
接下来就是超多的缺点：
1、剧情槽点很多，不论是小塔抱头蹲防大喊索尼克救救我，还是没头脑的纳克鲁斯司令官和0作用的小动物军团送团灭送的比谁都快（你们甚至不找点军事素养高点的的人比如露姬或者夏特当司令官），以及充满bug的红宝石和踢飞就没下文的豺狼队长，甚至还把世代经典索和现代索从过去与现在的关系直接改成了平行世界，整个剧情把之前游戏的人物塑造毁的一塌糊涂不说还越改越乱，甚至希弗尔怎么来到现在的我要去官方漫画才要找到答案，所以为什么不在游戏里说完，是不喜欢吗？
2、关卡流程太短，在之前有索尼克世代这么优秀的关卡设计的情况下，力量的关卡长度几乎在1分-2分之间就能完成，每次游玩就像打胶打一半结果就憋回去一样尴尬，不知道是不是工期不足的原因导致关卡长度缩水
3、游戏模式设计的很宏大结果还是世代那一套，剧情上蛋头博士征服了世界，按理说这么宏大的背景，学习大冒险、英雄和06那样的多角色关卡不香么，音速小队、艾咪、希弗尔、黑暗小队和卡奥蒂斯侦探社就是个讲剧情的工具人，最后还是经典索、现代索和玩家角色打通关，甚至夏特只是一个dlc人物出现，自己的篇章也仅仅只有3关
4、玩家角色设计多余，每个种族除了鸟的2连跳有点用，其他的对于想无伤通关的玩家来说几乎0作用，个人特点也只是换几把枪的区别，甚至没有boost系统玩着很无聊，换装系统和捏脸系统更是让人眼前一黑，游戏中的的塑造几乎没有，与其浪费这么多时间在玩家身上还不如把资源投入到经典索和小塔的剧情上，再把玩家的关卡分给其他主角团

185724739.review:
This game is an insult to the series. It is creatively bankrupt drivel: mediocre story, mediocre levels, mediocre lore. For whatever it's worth, this game is not glitchy and broken; Sega made two of the most infamously glitchy broken video games eight years apart and certainly did not want to repeat that and I supposed they technically succeeded with that. To an extent though, I genuinely believe that even the glitchy broken mess of a game that is Sonic '06 has more value than this, because even if it was ruined back then by Sega's horrifically rushed development time, it still feels like a game that was actually trying big and failing hard. For them to have released this back then almost literally alongside Sonic Mania was  genuinely hilarious. The literal Team Sonic's big new game was a very wide 2nd place in their own franchise to what was basically a glorified fan game. 

The modern sonic stages make the boost feel like just a win button, the classic sonic handling and stage design feel abhorrent and do nothing to actually justify his inclusion other than tying this to a vastly superior video game that is literally amazing at both, and while the concept of the avatar stuff is cute and entertaining, the game and its levels do not feel anywhere near interesting or entertaining enough to make them feel worth it.

Playing this back in 2017 (on console) was awful, and trying to play it again now is awful. There are WAY better Sonic games on this platform, especially now. Sega/Team Sonic feel like they've gotten their s*** together the past few years with Frontiers and Shadow Generations as well as the side games. Between the game quality, the comics, and heck the movie franchise, the 2020's really feel like a genuine renaissance for the franchise and I am very happy to see it. Hopefully that trend continues into the future.

Here's a list of every sonic game on steam that would objectively be more worth your time than this:

3D Games: Frontiers, Sonic x Shadow Generations, Adventure, Adventure 2, Colors 

2D Games: Mania, Origins Plus (1, 2, CD, 3&K), Superstars

Side Games: The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog, any of the racing games

185678194.review:
[h1]Sonic Forces me to write a negative review[/h1]
Released as part of the series' 25th Anniversary, this is among one of the weakest mainline entries in the entire franchise.

There are three playable characters to play as, starting with Modern Sonic who is nowhere near as fun to play as compared to previous and future games. Everything that made the other boost games enjoyable to play is nowhere to be found here and even feels a bit slower. The Avatar was a pretty cool concept, but very lacking in execution. You unlock extra custom parts from completing missions and those can be used to dress up your avatar however you want. I barely feel like I'm the main hero of the story, however, given that you spend most of the game playing as the other characters instead of your avatar.

Returning from Colours and Lost World are wisps, which were a fun addition to those games as they were used to explore levels in different ways providing unique experiences on repeat plays. You will find none of that here. Each avatar gets a wispon to equip, but you can only carry one at a time. Only wisps that match the currently used wispon can be picked up and used mid-level which severely limits their potential. Burst does the job in every situation, with zero incentive to try anything else.

Wispons provide some of the most dull and shallow combat I've ever experienced in a 3D platformer. Each wispon attacks in different ways, but the only good one is Burst as it has good range and keeps you on the move. The others are all terrible as they are either awkward to handle like Cube, or stop you when using them like Lightning. Enemies stand no chance - all foes are defeated in one hit in the exact same way so experimenting with different wispons is pointless.

Both of the other characters are still way more fun to play as compared to Classic Sonic, who is bar none the worst part of the entire game. Movement is very stiff making it hard to enjoy even the most basic of platforming. Physics and momentum barely work - I can't run down massive slopes and gain massive speeds to gain massive air from the ramp at the bottom when this was effortless to do back in 1992, for example. The only positive with Classic Sonic is that the drop dash from Mania is present.

Control is really jank. Acceleration feels off in ways the other games don't, and platforming in 2D feels quite stiff compared to the other 2D games that felt far more responsive. That's just Modern Sonic - as the Avatar, there were times where you suddenly speed up for no reason which has resulted in missed jumps, and pressing the opposite direction mid-jump carries all forward momentum whereas letting go of the direction has you stop completely, which really throws me off as Classic Sonic is the exact opposite of this.

For all of you level designers out there, use this game as an example of what to avoid. Most levels can be summed up as boost to win where all you do is hold down a button and watch as Sonic speeds through everything in his path. No fast reactions, no reward for sticking to the fastest routes and barely any exploration. Levels are forgettable as almost all of them play the same with only 2 exceptions, those being Egg Gate for being the only showcase of branching paths done right in this entire game, and Network Terminal which utilises spinning platforms and pink water in a very creative way not found elsewhere.

Mortar Canyon, the only fully 3D level, outright punishes you for trying to play the game. There's several branching paths that all lead to nothing, most of the stage can be cleared by simple homing attack chains or boosting over everything, and in the middle of the stage there's a ramp that takes you over the more difficult slower paths rewarding you with a red ring for doing so.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3404910447
Levels do not escalate in difficulty once - the final level is just as easy to finish as the first one. There are difficulty settings, but they barely do anything. All that Hard Mode does is make you lose all your rings when you get hit - level design is not altered based on the difficulty chosen, and all my deaths were from one hit deaths anyway making this setting useless.

Levels average 1.5 minutes in length which is far too short for a Sonic game, and the main story can be beaten in around 3 hours making this a very short game, but it felt much longer than that due to how bland the experience was. S ranks feel more like participation trophies due to how easy they are to obtain, limiting replayability. Any cool moments are entirely automated, as is turning on corners.

This game does not look good for a 2017 game. Environments look bland and do not invoke the imagination in any way; all you get is just Green Hill, Chemical Plant and Metropolis the entire time. Characters feel like lifeless vessels due to lacking idle animations that every other game in the series had, and barely express themselves during cutscenes or gameplay. Explosions look terrible like they came from the N64. Sonic Unleashed, a PS3 game from 2008, looks leaps and bounds better than this game does even on the highest graphics settings available. Performance is consistent at 60FPS with minimal loading times, but that alone isn't impressive.

I can't even speak positively about the story. Much like all the games in the 2010's, this was written by people that knew nothing about this franchise and it shows due to the amount of inconsistencies and continuity errors present in the plot. Tails had all his character development ruined by cowering in fear in front of Chaos 0 when he fought Chaos 4 in the past.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3403545205
Classic Sonic is now from another dimension (Mania) even though Classic Sonic from Generations was his younger self.

Several plot elements are introduced and immediately discarded like they're nothing. Null Space had potential for a cool level, but it's nothing more than a Double Boost QTE that's over in 5 seconds. Unlike previous games which show you what happens in the story thus adding immersion, most cutscenes in this game just tell you everything that happens instead making it feel less immersive than even the Mega Drive games that told compelling narratives with zero dialogue. For example, Eggman takes over the world via a black screen with text.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3403544513
To further showcase a lack of care when it comes to world building, the main city in this game is just called "City" - they didn't even bother giving it a name.

For achievement hunters, this game is very tedious to 100% with zero respect for your time. There are missions that require you to defeat a certain amount of enemies with a certain action, only to unlock another mission where you do the same thing again but with 2 more enemies to defeat; you still have to do it again even if you met the requirements the first time. There are achievements for gathering 100,000 rings which is very time consuming. Each level also has 5 numbered rings and moon rings, but can only be collected [i]after[/i] finding all the red rings in a level making it pointless filler and they don't unlock anything outside of achievements.

In short, there's basically nothing this game has to offer in the current year. Don't buy Sonic Forces - don't even get it on discount. If boost gameplay is what you're looking for, Sonic X Shadow Generations, Colours and Unleashed do it way better. If you want classic 2D gameplay, Mania, Origins and Superstars are far better alternatives. If you enjoy world building with actually good combat, Frontiers has you covered. For well written stories, pick up the Adventure games instead. I even had more fun playing Sonic 06 than I did this game; despite being far more polished and bug free, it was also far more forgettable and lacked anything resembling care or passion.

185506415.review:
[b]Rating: [/b] ★★ - Bad
[b]Time Played:[/b] 1.5 hours

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
• Mix of 2D side-scrolling and 3D stages with your original Character, Sonic and Retro Sonic; both with inconsistent level design that ranges from boring to decent.
• Custom Sonic Original Character Creation starts off poorly but as you unlock things from completing Missions you can customise your character more.
• Occasional control issues where the characters can feel floaty, especially during precision platforming.
	
[b]Story\Dialogue:[/b]
• Typical "stop the villain" plot, with Eggman teaming up with a mysterious antagonist, Infinite.
• Surprisingly darker tone but lacks depth in its execution.
• Character interactions are minimal and often forgettable.
	
[b]Graphics\Music:[/b]
• Unknown characters are badly designed, while the well-known largely look like their typical selves.
• Vibrant and colourful visuals with smooth animations. While places look well done, some environments feel uninspired in layout.
• Soundtrack features energetic and varied tracks that complement the fast-paced gameplay well.
• Voice acting is hit-or-miss, with some lines feeling awkward or poorly delivered.
	
[b]Before you Buy:[/b]
• For the non-Sonic fanbase, this is a middling-average Sonic game, ruined further by common crashing and corruption of saves; my first crash and wipe of save data was at the 1.5 hour mark.
• For the Sonic fanbase, unless you plan to download mod overhauls (Like Sonic Forces Overclocked), I suggest getting it on console instead.
• Be prepared for short levels without much variety, which can make the game feel less substantial overall.
• Strongly recommend 'Sonic X Shadow Generations' or 'Sonic Colors' instead.

185389424.review:
Can barely give this a recommendation. Probably swayed from being a huge Sonic fan.

Game is short. Did main story and episode Shadow in under 5 hrs. I probably could've gone through it faster too. Episode Shadow is just a few minutes long.
Classic Sonic was an unnecessary addition. Sonic and the Avatar had enough 2d sections.
The game had quite a bit of hallway/tunnel gameplay like Sonic Dash and Sonic Forces: Speed Battle. Just a bit too much.
Story and stages felt all over the place. Hoping back n forth. In the end, didn't feel like a lot of variety. Like 5 or 6 stages and varieties of them drawn out into 30 missions using the different characters.

The avatar customization and avatar character was a huge highlight. Wish they did more with it and the avatar gameplay. More wispon usage. Taken some inspiration from Ratchet & Clank. Let us swap wispon on the fly mid level.
At it's core, the story was good, just could've been presented better. Infinite is great in design and voiced well.
Does look like there's quite a bit of replayability with red rings, ranks, and missions for avatar clothing. Not really too excited about going for 100%. Some of the platforming sections were annoying, but not crazy difficult. Just take lots of time and patience. Red rings are fairly obviously placed, just easy to miss. Hard to or impossible to backtrack to them in most stages too.

Graphics overall were good. Some of the characters felt awkward idling in the background though like vr clones. And the ending with all the npcs being avatar clones felt too copy pasta.

Music was good, but not a huge variety of tracks.

185352416.review:
Sonic Forces fue mi primera incursión en la saga de Sonic, y debo decir que me dejó una muy buena impresión. Como novato en juegos de Sonic, encontré que Forces logró captar mi interés desde el principio. Lo que más me atrajo fue la velocidad frenética y la acción constante que ofrece el juego. La capacidad de alternar entre Sonic clásico y moderno, junto con la introducción de un nuevo personaje personalizable, añadió variedad y frescura a la experiencia.

Una de las cosas que realmente disfruté fue la narrativa. Aunque simple, logró mantenerme interesado en la historia y en los personajes. La idea de unirse con personajes icónicos como Tails y Knuckles para derrotar al malvado Dr. Eggman y su nuevo aliado, Infinite, me mantuvo motivado para avanzar.

Gráficamente, el juego es colorido y vibrante, con mundos bien diseñados que capturan la esencia de los juegos de Sonic. La música también fue un punto destacado para mí; las pistas son pegajosas y encajan perfectamente con la acción y el ambiente del juego.

Sin embargo, como jugador nuevo en la saga, noté algunas críticas que podrían no molestar a los fanáticos de toda la vida, pero que me pareció importante mencionar. Por ejemplo, la duración del juego podría haber sido un poco más larga, y algunas secciones se sintieron un poco repetitivas. Además, hubo momentos en los que la cámara no cooperaba del todo bien, lo que ocasionalmente afectó mi experiencia de juego.

En resumen, Sonic Forces me hizo fan de la saga Sonic y me inspiró a jugar los juegos clásicos. Es un juego que, aunque tiene sus pequeños inconvenientes, ofrece una experiencia emocionante y divertida para aquellos que buscan acción rápida y personajes carismáticos.

184404253.review: Yeah, I don't get the hate for this game.  It isn't bad.  The levels are fun, the story is good (for a Sonic game), the environments are neat, and the music is great.  I dunno what anyone else wants from a Sonic game.

184396401.review: me gusta la historia, los niveles, para que decir de la banda sonora muy bueno este juego lo recomiendo

184390038.review: Without mods this game is very mid and isnt worth it. only buy if your gonna use mods

184381254.review: i bet the actual game is awful but OMG OVERCLOCKED IS AWESOME

184280218.review: Only buy this on sale, disregard the base game, and install Sonic Forces: Overclocked.

184274545.review: Sonic Forces is like the anti-platformer. It doesn't want you to engage with it in any meaningful way during your playthrough of the main story, instead you're railroaded into one of the most linear cinematic platforming games ever released, and calling it a "game" is very generous indeed. I can't believe this game costs actual money too. It's ridiculous how something like this could even be released. Outside of clean visuals and some cool music here and there, what does this game offer that Sonic Generations doesn't? Nothing that I can think of other than the Avatar stages.

184271309.review: I love Sonic but I'll stick to the original games or movies. Every newer game of Sonic on Steam is a complete waste of money, even when buying on sale. You can press the same button at the exact moment of the same situation and get a completely different result.

184267060.review: I have played this game multiple times before on a playstation 4 and i still like to play it even on my PC it think this is a good game to play and i would recommend it to other people that like playing sonic games and the thing i like about it is that it's just fun to customise your very own character and obviously create one and to play as classic sonic and modern sonic also the character but downside it only has 30 stages and some could complete the story maybe in less than two hours if they skip dialog and cut scenes

184222022.review: The game is really fun, Im a 10 year old who REALLY likes this game. It's one of my favorites to the sonic franchise, I've played many sonic games. But none like this! It's very exciting when you beat the bosses, some levels are hard to beat. I recommend that you play normal/easy mode before hard mode.

184221069.review: This game was a lot better than I thought it would be. A lot of people say this game sucks but it was pretty good.

184207980.review: This game sucks and is very, very bad. Very, very bad game. I'm glad Sonic's in a much better place now and I hope we never get a game like this ever again.

184191801.review: Literally the worst game I have ever played in my life, I wouldn't recommend someone to play it even if it was free

184176781.review:
i finally decided to pick this game up again after years of not playing it. I loved it when it came out, I was a child then. I'm no longer a child anymore.

six - nearly seven years later, I cant begin to tell you how much this game is the definition of mediocre. From the awful story, to the awful game play, there's a lot to rip into.

First off the story is genuinely awful as I said. If you're name isn't sonic or "Rookie", you are stuck to the sidelines with nothing to do. Tails in this game was the worst offender. 
The game play is even worse. The levels in this game feel lazy and uninspired. They feel like you are running in a straight line all the way through. Barely any branching paths and the few that exist are so obvious its genuinely funny. The characters you play as are garbage too. Classic Sonic controls like a brick and for some parts YOU WILL LOSE MOMENTUM WHEN IT DOES NOT MAKE SENSE TO DO SO. Hes genuinely the worst of the three. Modern sonic is not any better. Many of his moves from earlier games are gone including drifting. Making him feel more stripped back and bare bones from those previous games. 

Last one is the Rookie. He feels like an even more stripped back version of the sonic in this game. They try some new things like the Wispon and the grapple. The Wispon is implemented....fine, but definitely nothing new. The grapple is mostly either in place of a homing attack or just for set pieces, its also nothing special. The only thing I would say was great about the avatar was the customization. 

In fact that's all this game has that's really good. You just have to actually play the game to unlock the options in order to customize the character, and that is not fun. 

overall this game was a complete step in the wrong direction for Sega and they did not do this game any favors. If you REALLY want to pick this game up for whatever reason, wait for it to go on sale. Otherwise I would not recommend this game.

184067969.review: esta cosa solo destaca por poder tener un personaje propio, pero esta super limitado jsjsj, igual ni tan malo el juego (a pesar de que el juego es puro fan service en su maximo esplendor)

184030702.review: This Is Not A Pro Gamer Move In Fact, It Belongs In The Bin 1/10

184020535.review: While the story is mishandled, it is nice to see sonic games in a serious tone. and making my own sonic character for sure is a awesome thing to do as a lifelong sonic fan. game play was better then I expected with the rating. but I enjoyed it thoroughly even with a few glaring flaws

184019794.review: La mejor parte de este juego fue cuando me devolvieron la plata

183935466.review: its fine but do NOT spend full price,

183843287.review: I don't really get why this game gets a ton of hate compared to other modern Sonic games. Levels could've been longer, and I'd rather this had stuck with the ring-based boost mechanic over whisps, but I wouldn't consign it to the garbage tier just for that. Not the first Sonic game I'd pick if I had to play them all over again, but if you've already played the Generations remaster and want some more levels then maybe pick this one up on a sale sometime.

183842248.review: its short, so get it on sale, but its a good time

183839078.review: it is fun and not what you expect and it will be hard at some levals good luck

183821390.review: great game super brainrot love it

183743908.review: I am a Sonic fan, but this game, as many, MANY, other people have said, this game sucks. All characters control like a brick and the levels are simple and short, I won't delve into what everyone already knows, but this game isn't worth anything, I got it as a gift.

183670873.review: this game is straight buns bro. Just play Generations or any other Sonic game for that matter

183602440.review: the mods are the only reason youd get this (sonic overclocked for example)

183532539.review:
Don't buy Forces unless it's 75% off (lowest price) and if you plan on installing mods (which will cost about 25 gigabytes of your local storage). Also, if you want Forces, consider Sonic Colors: Ultimate as an alternative. Even though that game has it's issues, I've found it to be more re-playable than this.
In other words, Forces isn't worth much when you have better options for Sonic games or similar. There's like 4 other titles that have way more meat to them.
